meanings.definition: To be loudly and persistently shouted at or demanded
meanings.sent1: The students beclamored for more recess time.
meanings.sent2: The protesters beclamored for justice outside the courthouse.
meanings.sent3: The children beclamored for candy at the store.
meanings.sent4: The fans beclamored for autographs from their favorite singer.
meanings.sent5: The audience beclamored for an encore after the amazing performance.

meanings.definition: To be filled with loud and confused noise or shouting
meanings.sent1: The marketplace was beclamored with vendors calling out their prices.
meanings.sent2: The stadium beclamored with cheers as the home team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was beclamored with the sounds of pots and pans clanging.
meanings.sent4: The forest beclamored with the chirping of birds at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The city streets beclamored with the honking of cars during rush hour.
